reviewText: I just threw this in the garbage rather than pass it on to anyone.  In every single scenario, no matter how unrealistic, the mother was the problem.  The father was always the reasonable one.  I suppose that might help some men get on board with this, but it certainly won't improve their willingness to compromise. It perpetuates the stereotype of women being to blame for problematic children.  What about the absent or abusive fathers out there?
